newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian peso slips to end at 1,040.30.
newsitem.headline: Colombian peso slips to end at 1,040.30.

text.p: Colombia's peso ended slightly lower at 1,040.30 as banks and importers jumped into the interbank market to cover short dollar positions.
"People were expecting a big drop in the (dollar) rate. But when they saw that no more dollars were entering the market, they decided to go out and buy," one dealer said in a telephone interview.
Dealers said the peso, which traded in a 1,031 to 1,040.30 range, closed down 1.85 pesos at the session's weakest level.
Dealers said oil export revenues help push the peso higher early in the session, and that it had been expected to extend the previous day's gains by ending at about 1,037.
But the local currency weakened on late day dollar-buying, including what one trader described as a flurry of buy orders from state-run banks.
Dealers reported 331 trades in Wednesday's session for a total of $135 million.
